title: Have Americans ever read Bhagavad Gita? - Quora
tags: Culture of the United States of America

response.answer_text: It is difficult for me to say because I have not been in much touch with American people. But coming to point, if at all they want to read Bhagvad Gita, they would require to add some words in the dictionary. for example, There are no separate words for ब्रह्म, आत्मा, ईश्वर, जीव । in English dictionary. Soul, consciousness, universal consciousness etc are words but they don't convey the exact meaning of what sanskrit words mean. प्रकृति is translated as nature but Bhagvad Gita has more expansive meaning than simply nature. कमॅ is translated as action but in indian philosophy, any modifications in material things विकार is form of कमॅ. Even thinking and speaking also are कमॅ Finally, environment, culture, sanskars संस्कार etc also play important role in understanding Bhagvad Gita with correct meaning and then follow it in real life. Even if they read Bhagvad Gita, they will be intellectually rich but whether they will follow it or not is uncertain. forget Americans, even in India and in Hindu families,very few have read and out of those few, how many have understood it's exact purport is doubtful.

Millions indeed since 1968. Srila Prabhupada was on that mission only -to spread the message of Krishna to Western countries. After establishing ISKCON in 1966, a press was started which has now expanded to Bhaktivedanta Book Trust and printing Bhagwat Gita As it Is. Hare Krishna.
